 Description   

Per 2015-08-11 email from Nishith (attached), the WUP.CU_SURFACE.CU_APNUM and WUP.CU_WELLS.CU_APNUM columns were migrated to REGUSER.REG_PROJ_ET.CUR_ID. All rows in REG_PROJ_ET, however, will have a CUR_ID values (it's the primary key), even new rows.

In our derived GIS.STATIONS data set, we would like to store the original CU_APNUM values in the LEGACY_PERMIT_NUMBER column, but need a way to differentiate between CUR_ID values that contain legacy permit numbers, and those that contain new, arbitrary CUR_ID values.

 Comments   
Comment by Michael Mannion [ 26/Sep/15 ]

We have had several discussions, both internally and with SJRWMD, regarding this topic. Presently, it appears that there is no longer a need to reference content stored in legacy NWFWMD systems; all data that needs to be migrated to NWPROD/eReg has been migrated, or will be migrated upon request (as several additional columns have been in recent months). Therefore, users are expected to find all of the information they need directly within NWPROD and, in turn, can ignore whether an application/permit was generated in the legacy system or the current one.

For reference, however, note the following:

  • Nishith migrated WUP data first, and assigned CU_APP.APNUM to OFFCL_ID (and, correspondingly, CUR_ID for the first sequence). ERP/MSSW were migrated subsequently, continuing CUR_ID numbering with the next available sequence value. Legacy WUP records can be identified by having a CUR_ID that is less than or equal to a cutoff number representing the highest APNUM value used during the migration.
  • Per Yamila, the last APNUM value is 7541. WUP records with CUR_ID values higher than 7541 have been generated in the current system.

Comment by Michael Mannion [ 26/Sep/15 ]

Per Danny in 2015-09-14 meeting:

  • The existing datum information is not trustworthy
  • Current public/eReg users are not sufficiently knowledgeable with respect to datums to populate this information reliably going forward
  • The datum shift in the area of interest is small enough relative to the precision of the point locations being captured to be effectively irrelevant

Therefore, we have updated all refresh procedures to disregard any datum information, even when present, and assume that the datum of the coordinates stored matches the target datum of the derived data set. Accordingly, we do not need to verify that MSSW datum information was migrated from the legacy system.

Attachments: RE Coordinate datums for NWFWMD.msg    

 Description   

Per 2015-7-15 email from Nishith (attached), two new columns were added to REGUSER.PROJ_SITE and populated from the legacy database:

  • CTRL_DTM_CD
  • CRDNT_CD

The former contains datum information from ERP.ERP_PROJECT.DATUM (and should contain equivalent information from MSSW.MSSW_PROJECTS.DATUM). The latter contains a constant indicating that the migrated data is stored in DMS format.

QUESTION: How will these columns be populated and maintained over time?

Specifically, we need to determine the software (e.g. eReg, e-Permitting) and workflow by which this information can be managed. Users responsible for capturing and maintaining the datum / coordinate code will also need notice and/or training.

 Comments   
Comment by Michael Mannion [ 02/Sep/15 ]

2015-09-02 meeting:

  • UI does not validate coordinate values in text box
  • Users should be entering in DMS format
  • eReg should automatically:
    • Set datum to NAD83 for new coordinates
    • Set coordinate code to DMS for new coordinates
    • Validate DMS format

[NWFWMDDI-3] Should REGUSER.PROJ_SITE include a MTHD_DTRMN_CD column? Created: 14/Aug/15  Updated: 10/Sep/15  Resolved: 18/Aug/15

Remaining Estimate: Not Specified
Time Spent: Not Specified
Original estimate: Not Specified

Attachments: RE Coordinate datums for NWFWMD.msg    

 Description   

The SJR.STN_ET table has a column, MTHD_DTRMN_CD, for indicating how the coordinate was captured (e.g. GPS, Map, Control Survey). The PROJ_SITE table does not have an equivalent column, but that column could be added, per Nishith (see 2015-07-21 email, attached).

Question 1: Should we add a MTHD_DTRMN_CD column to PROJ_SITE?

Question 2: If we do add this column, how will it be populated going forward?

Per Question 2, we need to consider two points:

  1. How, through the software (e.g. eReg, e-Permitting) will users set the method determiniation?
  2. What needs to change in the existing data creation/maintenance workflow to ensure that this information is populated?

 Comments   
Comment by Michael Mannion [ 18/Aug/15 ]

Answer 1: No, we do not need to store MTHD_DTRMN_CD for PROJ_SITE

Per notes in nwfwmd_sjrwmd_config.xlsx, we (NW) decided in an earlier meeting that this column wasn't necessary. Per 2015-08-18 meeting with Yamila, MSSW and forestry do not have this information in the legacy database, anyway.

Answer 2: Question 2 is out of scope, based on Answer 1.




[NWFWMDDI-2] Set feature extent to district boundary when creating new derived feature classes Created: 09/Jul/15  Updated: 28/May/19

Status: To Do
Project: NWFWMD Data Integration
Components: Replication
Affects versions: None
Fix versions: None

Type: Enhancement Priority: Major
Reporter: Michael Mannion Assignee: Michael Mannion
Resolution: Unresolved Votes: 0
Labels: None
Remaining Estimate: Not Specified
Time Spent: Not Specified
Original estimate: Not Specified


 Description   

When creating new derived feature classes using the Python API (create_feature_classes_system_integration.py) all values for the feature extent are set to zero. This causes ArcGIS for Desktop clients (and possibly others) to zoom to the full extent of the globe, which is inconvenient for users.

Unlike when loading/editing through Desktop, populating the feature classes using the SQL API does not automatically set or expand the feature extent. Currently, it's possible to update the extent using the "Feature Class Properties" dialog > "Feature Extent" tab, but this is a manual process. We've opened Esri Support case #01659132 seeking an automated method.

 Comments   
Comment by Michael Mannion [ 09/Jul/15 ]

Added warning message to create_feature_classes_system_integration.py output reminding feature class creator to automatically set feature extent to District boundary

Comment by Michael Mannion [ 09/Jul/15 ]

Scheduled maintenance window for 21:00 EDT to release Server/Desktop locks on GIS.DATABASES_% feature classes in order to update feature extents for existing data sets

Comment by Michael Mannion [ 26/Sep/15 ]

Sent second follow-up email to Esri asking for enhancement request tracking number.

 Description   

When converting FAC_RULE_ID values to human-readable text, we're currently using DECODE() with a list of literals that match the legacy implementation. Change this to decode using the INGRES.SJR_ABBR_ALIAS.ALIAS_TP_DSC value instead.

 Comments   
Comment by Michael Mannion [ 26/Sep/15 ]

All coded values in both derived feature classes are now properly decoded using one of the following three tables:

  • INGRES.SJR_ABBR_DEF_ET
  • INGRES.SJR_ABBR_ALIAS
  • INGRES.SJR_ABBR_GRP_ET
